injectedObject element¶

Element injectedObject can be used to specify a value that will be injected by IoC.Configuration.

The type to inject is specified using either type attribute (and optional assembly attribute), or typeRef attribute.

If the type to inject is non-abstract and non-interface, and has a public constructor, IoC.Configuration will create a binding for the type.

Otherwise, a binding for the type should be specified either in configuration file, or in one of the loaded IoC modules.

Example 1: Using injectedObject element to specify service implementation constructor parameter value¶

 1<service type="SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface2" >
 2    <implementation type="SharedServices.Implementations.Interface2_Impl1"
 3                    scope="singleton">
 4        <parameters>
 5            <datetime name="param1" value="2014-10-29 23:59:59.099" />
 6            <double name="param2" value="125.1" />
 7            <injectedObject name="param3"
 8                            type="SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface3" />
 9        </parameters>
10    </implementation>
11</service>

Example 2: Using injectedObject element to specify injected property value in service implementation¶

 1<service type="SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface2" >
 2    <implementation type="SharedServices.Implementations.Interface2_Impl2"
 3                    scope="singleton">
 4        <injectedProperties>
 5          <datetime name="Property1"
 6                    value="1915-04-24 00:00:00.001" />
 7          <double name="Property2" value="365.41" />
 8          <injectedObject name="Property3"
 9                          type="SharedServices.Interfaces.IInterface3" />
10        </injectedProperties>
11    </implementation>
12</service>

Example 2: Using injectedObject element to specify a returned value in autoProperty element¶

1<autoService interface="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.IActionValidatorFactory">
2    <autoProperty name="DefaultActionValidator"
3                  returnType="SharedServices.Interfaces.IActionValidator">
4      <injectedObject
5            type="IoC.Configuration.Tests.AutoService.Services.ActionValidatorDefault"/>
6    </autoProperty>
7</autoService>
